intro: Epilobium ciliatum, commonly known as the silky willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with finely toothed margins and a soft, hairy texture. Epilobium ciliatum is often found in moist, calcareous soils in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
